titles.title: To provide for the continued sale of power by Federal Power Marketing agencies to preference entities using power at military installations selected for closure.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations.

bill.summary: 10/27/1993--Introduced. Declares that for a ten-year period specified electric power allocations provided by each Federal Power Marketing Administration shall be reserved for sale to preference entities that agree to use such power to promote economic development at a military installation that is either closed or selected for closure.
